Biography

Jon Wallace Hall, 69, of Hewitt passed away Thursday, April 26, 2012 at his home with his family by his side. Funeral Services will be held at 2PM Monday, April 30, 2012 at Woodway First United Methodist Church with Rev. John Dirk, Rev. Bill Austin and Dawn Gilliland officiating. Visitation will be 1 to 3PM Sunday, April 29, 2012 at Grace Gardens Funeral Home Chapel.

Jon was born January 23, 1943 in San Antonio, Texas to Robert A. Hall, Sr. and Thelma S. Hall. Jon attended San Antonio schools and graduated from Edison in 1961. He attended San Antonio College and received an Associates degree in Electronics. On August 23, 1969, he married Mary Frances Fleming in San Antonio, Texas. He worked for Sperry Univac (Unisys) for 26 years as a Customer Engineer first repairing mainframe computers and later repairing smaller computers throughout the Central Texas area. He demonstrated his compassion and caring for people while on the job as well as in his personal life. Some of his most treasured experiences were coaching his daughter’s Midway Little League softball teams including the year his All-Star team played in the Southern Regionals in Florida in 1985. He enjoyed sharing a common love of personal computers (PC’s) with his son. He served wherever he was needed in his church with a warm smile on his face. His greatest delight was his family; his loving wife, Mary, his children, Jennifer & Brad & his son-in-law, Jim and his precious grand-children, Evan & Emma. He was “the dog man” & had many loyal pets, including his devoted labs, Chas & Frosty.

He was preceded in death by his parents and his brother, Robert A. Hall, Jr.

Jon is survived by his loving wife, Mary F. Hall, his daughter, Jennifer Harper and husband Jim of Coppell; son, Brad Hall of Waco; his grandchildren, Evan and Emma Harper of Coppell; his brother, Dr. Douglas Hall of San Antonio; his sister-in-law, Martha O. Hall of Bedford; his brother-in-law, Bill Fleming of Waco; his sister-in-law, Mary Fleming Daniels of Warsaw, MO; his nephews Robert A. Hall, III (wife Marsha) of Euless, Lt. Col. Richard Hall (Ret.) (wife Christine) of Huntsville, AL, and Michael Hall (wife Alison) of Gilbert, AZ; cousins Libby Croft of Abilene and Lita Holland of San Antonio; great nieces, great nephews, great friends and his loyal dog, Frosty.

Special thanks to St. Paul’s Heart & Lung Transplant doctors & nurses, the Bluebonnet Hospice team and our special friend, Dawn Gilliland.

Memorials may be made to Woodway First United Methodist Church, 21000 Woodway Drive, Woodway, Texas 76712 or Southwest Transplant Alliance, 5489 Blair Road, Dallas, Texas 75231.

Funeral Service

Monday April 30, 2012 , 2PM at Woodway First United Methodist Church

Visitation

Sunday April 29, 2012 , 1 - 3PM at Grace Gardens Funeral Home Chapel
